lines.text: [first lines]
How's that, Wade? Hit him every time!

not bad; but your speed, not so good. That's because you're wastin' a lot of time slappin' leather. You're wearin' your gunbelt a little too high. That's it, lower it a little. You gotta have your wrist just so it's about touchin' your gun handle. That's about right. Now watch... you watch his eyes, never his hands.
[Addams puts a hole right between the eyes of Tris Hatten's wanted poster]
A wasted shot cost many a fellow his life. Now, speed's important, but you gotta hit what you're aimin' at, too, you know.
Do you really think Tris Hatten's dead?

He's supposed to be, according to the legend. Of course, that legend's as phony as a brass good piece. It's the worst kind of killer that would shoot a man in the back just as soon as look at him. I kinda hope he's dead.
Be careful this time, Tris. There are pictures all over the place.

I know. Five thousand dollars, dead or alive, for the slaying of Sheriff Bates and his deputies. A sheriff as slow on the draw as old Bates deserved to die; him and those deputies of his. I did the county a favor gettin' rid of those yellow-bellies.
I wish I were a man for just an hour. I wish I were a man!
[Millie throws her drink in Wade's face]
I wish you were, too, Millie.
[Hatten learns that a 12-year-old boy was responsible for his arrest]
You don't think I look like the type that would go around shootin' little kids, do you?
You're the type that would shoot butterflies if you thought you could hit 'em.
There's a few punchin' jobs open.
We don't like nursemaidin' cows. Hard on the hands.
Never did like rope burns.
Well, on the hands they're not so bad, but on *other* parts of the body, they'd be kind of irritating.
We're three to your one, Sheriff.
[Wade guns down two of the Barlow boys]
Odds change fast, Barlow.
Did he shoot Clay?
That's right. Just like Hatten's going to shoot you. You're not going up against a guy like poor little Shorty.
Millie, be out of town by the time I get back.
You ain't comin' back!
You hit bad?
Ain't going to live to get hung. You call that bad?
[last lines]
Wade, you got him!
We'll talk about that later.
[Clay's pony whinnies]
You'll be riding him again soon.
